intro: Eriogonum smithii, commonly known as Smith's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum smithii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
